content: @Brett Marquard @Eric Haas For the C-CDA on FHIR, I'm still getting "unable to summarise profile http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-allergyintolerance (no profile found)" with the new ids for the profiles. I'm assuming that these will get resolved once everything is published? (I've tried to publish daf2 locally, but it looks like it hasn't been updated in a while and it crashes).

Grahame has published it here:http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/index.html
oh .. you need the resources too. I forgot to add as downloads in the IG ( add to my Punch list)

links: for downloads
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/definitions.json.zip
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/definitions.ttl.zip
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/definitions.xml.zip
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/examples.json.zip
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/examples.ttl.zip
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/examples.xml.zip

The most up to date source is here: https://github.com/Healthedata1/US-Core
Thanks!

the publish version is a bit stale I just finished applying most of the comments. so if you want a look at the latest is here: http://healthedatainc.com/go-ftp/US-Core/index.html hoping to have that up on the permanent site soon.
Cool - thanks Eric... So do I actually have to change anything in our IG? I'm assuming not, and once everything is publshed, those links will resolve and the core profiles will be rendered?
where is your IG?
the one in svn? I'll look at it tonight
Yeah, the one in SVN. Thanks!
@Grahame Grieve Let me know if there's something I can do to fix those references - I'll be working on it right up to ballot deadline I'm sure. Can't WAIT until this time Monday!!
All work is occurring in a separate git repo, Grahame has posted a version here for review: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/index.html
@Grahame Grieve did you manage to take a look at the us core references last night? (@Rick Geimer )
Obviously they all work fine when I download the us core stuff to my machine and run the IG publisher on that. But will they work when we publish

Let's rephrase. When will US Core be committed to gForge so that C-CDA on FHIR (which depends on DAF) can run a clean build. Do we get an extension on the Dec 4 deadline if US Core is not committed by then?
Ok, MAYBE that makes more sense that what I wrote...
Why does it matter if its in SVN or GitHub? It is separate from the build.
We can't extend much because we're tied to the ballot publication timelines. We've got a bit of a challenge with this cascade of dependencies.
Unless I am wrong, US Core is running in a completely different GitHub repository.
Which should not be the case ever again if true
It's not clear how copying into SVN helps you...

So I was thinking, that as long as we hve used the correct ids Like (http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-patient) then everything should work fine once we publish. The problem is that it doesn't work when we run it locally, so it makes me very nervous to have undefined profiles.
It doesn't automatically publish to a page until @Grahame Grieve 'pushes' a button
But I am just ASSUMING that it will all work....
I guess my question is, if I sync with gforge, should I get a clean US Core build? I assume yes, but currently the answer is no.
I know, that's why I need an assurance from Grahame that the us core stuff will work as long as we are using the correct identifiers
Well, the last stuff I pulled down for US Core, worked
Brett, if you don't see a problem, try syncing and running the C-CDA on FHIR IG to see what I mean.
I know there is a referencing problem, but loading Us-core doesn't solve your problem, we need some love from Grahame, and I am sure he will deliver
Yes, that's what I thought - just wanted a little reassurance. And to know I can blame it all on him... HA!
PS. US-core isn't even going to ballot....we updated as much as we could to help C-CDA on FHIR, and the connectathon...
You're the BEST!
Ok, then if we are all in agreement that a clean C-CDA on FHIR build is waiting for the Grahame-stock love-in until everything works in harmony, then we are good.

http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core is the permanent home for us-core content it will resolve to that. Why do you need a "clean us-core build"? All I thought you needed was the definition.zip file ( see above) and the url. do you need something else? Besides you can get the source from here https://github.com/Healthedata1/US-Core and build it with the IG publisher. When is complete we will copy it to SVN.
Sarah, I suggest you and I stop, stating that we believe everything to be content correct. Anything remaining should be ballot QA. Grahame will let us know if there is more work to be done.
Already have stopped and stated that above!
Eric/Brett: in the future would appreciate regular pushes to gForge when you get a clean build.
Would be nice to have one stop shopping when someone needs to run the IG publisher.
I will look at it. There's no reason not to have a one stop shop, and no reason to change from github.
I intended to look efore now, but got bogged down with content cahnges before freeze
Totally understand, and thanks!
